      • createUser

        public User createUser(@NonNull
                       @NonNull kickstart.user.RegistrationForm form)
        Creates a new User using the information given in the RegistrationForm.
        Parameters:
        form - must not be null.
        Returns:
        the new User instance.

      • editData

        public void editData(@NonNull
                     @NonNull kickstart.user.EditForm form)
        Edits a User using the information given in the EditForm.
        Parameters:
        form - must not be null. Contains Id of the User and the entered information. Empty fields in EditForm will be skipped.

      • findUser

        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public org.springframework.data.util.Streamable<User> findAll()

        Returns:
        all User entities.

      • findAllCustomers

        public org.springframework.data.util.Streamable<User> findAllCustomers()
        Returns all User with Role of Customer currently saved.
        Returns:
        all User with Role of Customer.

      • findAllEmployees

        public org.springframework.data.util.Streamable<User> findAllEmployees()

        Returns:
        all User with Role of Employee.

      • useraccountActivation

        public void useraccountActivation(@NonNull
                                  @NonNull org.salespointframework.useraccount.UserAccountIdentifier accountId,
                                  int type)
        Makes it possible to disable or enable a User for given UserAccountIdentifier and type.
        Parameters:
        accountId - must not be null.
        type - Definition: 0 for disable and 1 for enable.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no type is given.

      • changeRole

        public void changeRole(@NonNull
                       @NonNull User requestedUser,
                       @NonNull
                       @NonNull User loggedIn,
                       int type)
                throws UnAllowedException
        Makes it possible to change the Role of a given User.
        Parameters:
        requestedUser - must not be null. Contains User which should be changed.
        loggedIn - must not be null. Contains logged in User.
        type - Definition: 0 - customer to employee; 1 - employee to customer; 2 - employee to boss (admin); 3 - boss (admin) to employee
        Throws:
        UnAllowedException - if somebody try to change his own Role.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no type is given.

      • changeSalary

        public void changeSalary(@NonNull
                         @NonNull kickstart.user.MoneyForm form)
        Adjusts the salary for a User using the information given in the MoneyForm.
        Parameters:
        form - must not be null. Contains Id of the User and the new salary.
